description: The intentional killing of another person by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought.

charge: (F) | First Degree Murder of a Government Employee | CC166
description: The intentional killing of a government employee by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought.
The attempted intentional killing of another person by someone who has acted willfully, deliberately, and with planning and malice aforethought.
Causes the death of a person with the intention of killing, but that is not premeditated or planned.

charge: (F) | Second Degree Murder of a Government Employee | CC163
description: Causes the death of a government employee with the intention of killing, but is not premeditated or planned.
A person unintentionally causes another’s death by an intentional act, a felony act, or acts committed during a separate dangerous felony
A person unintentionally causes another’s death through criminal negligence or while committing a dangerous misdemeanor or infraction.
Intentionally engages in physical non-consensual contact that results in harm or offense to another person.

charge: (AF) | (INACTIVE) Assault with a Deadly Weapon | CC191
description: (INACTIVE) Intentionally and knowingly causing serious bodily harm using or displaying a deadly weapon during an assault.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes another person to fear imminent harm or offensive contact.
Keeps a person in an area or restrains them for an extended time against their will.
Acts of deadly violence or intimidation intended to coerce civilians, influence government, or advance an ideology. Requires evidence of both harmful acts and political/ideological motivation.
Intentionally threatening to kill or seriously harm someone else, which causes reasonable fear.
A pattern of repeated and unwanted attention, harassment, contact, or any other course of conduct directed at a specific person that would cause a reasonable person to feel fear.
Intentionally and repeatedly follows, communicates with, or otherwise harasses another person in a manner that causes them to reasonably fear for their safety or the safety of others.
Engages in conduct that creates a substantial risk of physical injury or death to another person.
Steals money or property through force or threats of force from a financial institution, government facility, licensed pharmacy or jewelry store.
Steals money or property through force or threats of force from a person or business.
(INACTIVE) Enters a property without consent and/or tampers with alarm systems.
The concealment of the origins of illegally obtained money, typically by means of transfers involving foreign banks or legitimate businesses.
Uses trusted access to steal or misappropriate funds from a private business. Fine subject to amount embezzled.
Uses trusted access to steal or misappropriate funds from a public institution or state agency. Fine subject to amount embezzled.
Found to engage in anticompetitive business practices that utilize illegal market manipulation tactics.
Creates false documentation, including ID cards, License Plates, Money, or Contracts.
Transports, possesses, or brings across state lines large quantities (25-39) of unregistered, or improperly registered weapons/explosives. Firearm attachments will not count towards this.
The selling or trading of weaponry or illegal firearm attachments without a valid permit.

charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 1 Firearm | CC310
description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 1 firearms. Stackable up to 5 times. Not combinable with CC300 or CC300B.
Possesses a vehicle without the consent of the owner or the legal right to possess it with the intent of permanently depriving the owner of the vehicle.

charge: (M) | Theft of a Motor Vehicle | CC202
description: Possesses a vehicle without the consent of the owner or the legal right to possess it without the intention of depriving the owner of the vehicle permanently.

The unlawful taking of money or property with a value of $4,999 or less. This includes theft from a person's immediate possession without force, or from an unattended source such as a vending machine or parking meter.
The wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain.
The wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain from a business or institution.
Moves or damages a deceased individual without consent from their next of kin, or without appropriate authority from the State.
The malicious and willful act of setting fire to any property, vehicle, or structure.
Deliberately displays a weapon in public without a legally justified reason.

charge: (M) | Failure to Obey a Lawful Order | CC400
description: Disobeys a lawful order from a Law Enforcement Officer or Officer of the Courts.
Flees from a police officer or resists being detained or arrested.
Flees in a vehicle from a police officer to avoid being detained or arrested.
Escapes the custody of a Law Enforcement Officer or Police Department.
Escapes from the custody of the state while being held in the confines of, in transport to/from Boilingbroke State Penn, or hospitalized for intensive care.

Any person who, after a felony has been committed, harbors, conceals or aids a principal in such felony, with the intent that said principal may avoid or escape from arrest, trial, conviction or punishment. Not reporting a principal is not in scope.

charge: (F) | Failure to Obey a Court Order | CC405
description: Disobeys a court order. Time/fine is at Judge’s discretion.
Incites violence as part of an assemblage of three or more persons.
The gathering of people intended to disturb the peace or commit an unlawful act.
Remains in a place without apparent purpose.
Intentionally provides false testimony under oath.
Shows disobedience or discourtesy to the Court or its officers. Can be stacked at will of the judge.
Interferes with the discovery, arrest, conviction, or punishment of a crime.
Acts as law enforcement without appropriate authority.
Reports a false or non-existent crime.
Offers a benefit to a public servant in return for beneficial treatment.

Public servant or official maliciously abuses the authority and access of their office, for the purpose of financial, political, personal gain, or used in bad faith. Time and fine decided in court if found guilty, minimum 25000. Hold until Trial.
Uses threats of future physician, emotional, or other harm for personal or financial gain.

Possesses or distributes 1-5 government-issued equipment. Does not include equipment legally distributed by government employees or possessed with authorization from the departments command. Charged per department, not per item. This charge is stackable.

Entering or remaining on private property without the lawful owner's consent, prosecutable only upon the owner's direct complaint or where the owner has granted the State trespass enforcement authority for the property.

A prosecutor or police officer overcharges someone in bad faith. A complaint for this charge may be initiated by a District Attorney, a Special Prosecutor, or through a formal motion filed with the Judiciary for review and consideration.
Hurts someone with intent to cause cruel, prolonged, or extreme pain and suffering for revenge, extortion, persuasion, or sadistic purposes.

An act of widespread violence or public disruption, characterized by its wanton and indiscriminate nature, which serves no discernible political or ideological purpose beyond the creation of public terror and the overwhelming of civic order.

charge: (M) | Criminal Use of a Firearm | CC306
description: Discharges a firearm during the commission of a separate misdemeanor or felony, or brandishes a firearm with the clear intent to intimidate or threaten another person outside the bounds of self-defense.
An act of targeted violence committed by a member of a criminal enterprise against a perceived rival faction or its associates.
Falsely represents themselves as an official of any government agency in a manner that is reasonably convincing.
Entering or remaining within any restricted government area where public access is clearly prohibited, or without authorization.
Possesses someone else's voter registration or uses it to cast a ballot in an official election.

Unlawfully interferes with the conduct of an official election through fraudulent, deceptive, or coercive means, including tampering with voting systems, dissemination of false information, intimidation of voters, or obstruction of voter access. Voter Fraud alone does not constitute Election Interference.

charge: (F) | Conspiracy to Commit Election Interference | CC415
description: Willfully conspires with others to unlawfully interfere with the conduct of an official election through fraudulent, deceptive, or coercive means. Cannot be combined with Election Interference. Voter Fraud alone does not constitute Election Interference.
Consumption, purchase, or possession of alcohol by any individual under the age of 21.

charge: (M) | Furnishing Alcohol to a Minor | CC122
description: Sells or furnishes alcohol to someone under the legal drinking age of 21. If found guilty, results in the revocation of liquor licenses of involved individual(s) and associated organization(s).
Commits Battery against an LEO during the lawful execution of the LEO's duties. Must be used in place of Battery when appropriate.

charge: (F) | (INACTIVE) Aggravated Battery against an LEO | CC192
description: (INACTIVE) Committing battery against an LEO that results in serious injury or involves the use of a deadly weapon while the officer is engaged in lawful duties.

charge: (F) | Attempted Murder of a Gov. Employee | CC160
description: The attempted intentional killing of a person who is employed by the government.

charge: (I) | Negligent Ownership of a Firearm | CC304
description: INACTIVE - Fails to exercise reasonable care in securing, handling, or using a firearm. INACTIVE

Transports, distributes, or cultivates large quantities of illegal substances. For this crime, large quantities are considered 200g+ marijuana, 4+ marijuana plants, 200g+ methamphetamine, 100g+ of Cocaine, or 40+ doses of other prescriptions or controlled substances.
Tampers, conceals, removes, or transports evidence of a crime that can be used by Law Enforcement or the Courts to detain, arrest, or prosecute a person/s.
Possesses 1-5 explosive devices, excluding fireworks, whether operational or not. This charge is stackable.
An act of targeted firearm violence committed by a member of a criminal enterprise against a perceived rival faction or its associates.
Takes 1-5 persons against their will and abducts them without consent. This charge is stackable.
Flies over restricted airspace without authorization (e.g., Boilingbroke State Penn., Fort Zancudo, Cayo).

charge: (I) | Negligent Operation of an Aircraft | AC551
description: Operates an aircraft in a way that is considered negligent. Comes with a free review of your pilot's license by licensing officials!

charge: (M) | Reckless Operation of an Aircraft | AC552
description: Operates an aircraft in a way that is considered reckless. Temporarily suspends Pilot's License until licensing review.
Operates an aircraft without permission from the owner or lawful right to operate the aircraft.

charge: (F) | Kidnapping of a Gov. Employee | CC173
description: Takes a Gov. Employee against their will and abducts them without consent. Gov. Employees include DOJ, DAO, PDO, SASP, Rangers, and SAMS.
Throws, places, or propels an explosive into, against, or upon any real or personal property or uses an explosive device against a person/s. Excludes fireworks.
The unlicensed manufacturing, fabrication, assembly, or conversion of firearms, destructive devices, or other prohibited weaponry.

charge: (M) | Criminal Possession of Weapon Attachments | CC305
description: Possession of aftermarket devices or components designed to fundamentally alter a firearm's standard function, capacity, or acoustic signature.

charge: (F) | Introducing Contraband into a Gov. Facility | CC417
description: Introducing, attempting to introduce, or possessing items that are considered contraband within a correctional facility.
When 2 or more persons join together and form an agreement to violate the law, then act on that agreement.
Intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime.
(INACTIVE) Intentionally and voluntarily participates with another in a crime by encouraging or assisting in the commission of the crime.
Takes one or more steps towards the commission of a crime.
(INACTIVE) Takes one or more steps towards the commission of a crime.
A utility charge to release an individual on bail until their trial date.
A utility charge to remand an individual to DOC custody until their trial date.
Used for time added during trial, not to be used by leo.

(INACTIVE) Aggravating factors include targeting public servants or government employees, the crime occurring in or around State buildings (hospitals, prisons, police stations, city hall), and for non-violent crimes, the use of deadly weapons.
Travels at excessive and reckless speed - greater than 35 mph+ over posted speed limit.
Driving a vehicle faster than legally allowed on a given road or highway. At least 5 mp/h over the limit.

Fails to come to a complete stop at a marked stop sign or solid red traffic signal. After stopping at a solid red signal, a driver may proceed only if it is safe to do so and they are not impeding the right-of-way traffic.
Drives without due care and attention.
Has window tint that obscures the view of the driver or passengers. Excludes government vehicles.
Fails to operate a vehicle in a proper lane of travel, or passes in a dangerous manner.
Driving, operating, or being in control of a vehicle while impaired by alcohol (>0.08 BAC) or drugs.

charge: (I) | Operating a Motor Vehicle without a License | HC508
description: Operates a motor without a valid driver's license in possession.

charge: (M) | Operating an Aircraft without a License | AC553
description: Operates an aircraft without a valid pilot's license in possession.
Parks outside of a designated space.(e.g., on/blocking a crosswalk, blocking a driveway, on the sidewalk, occupying multiple spots, etc)

charge: (I) | Violation of Disabled Parking Provisions | HC510
description: Parks in a space designated for disabled persons without a permit.

charge: (I) | Failure to Yield to Emergency Vehicles | HC511
description: Fails to pull to the side of the road to allow an emergency vehicle using lights and/or sirens to pass.

charge: (I) | Failure to Display License Plate | HC512
description: Fails to display an unobstructed view of a rear valid license plate. A vehicle may not be towed for this infraction alone.
Disrupts or stops the flow of traffic.
Follows another vehicle at an unsafe distance.
Participates in a race with a motor vehicle without a proper permit.

Any person who maliciously and willfully disturbs another person by loud and unreasonable noise, or who uses offensive words in a public place which are inherently likely to provoke an immediate violent reaction. Must be weighed against social benefits and rights.
Permits a passenger to travel inside the trunk or storage space, or in an otherwise unsafe manner of their vehicle.
Drives while wearing a headset, mask, or earplugs covering both ears of the driver.
Operates a vehicle that is not roadworthy, including excessive smoke/fumes, missing doors, damaged brake lights, bald or deflated tires, damaged headlights, etc.
Fails to pay the appropriate parking charges for a metered parking space.
Operates any vehicle not authorized or licensed for travel on a public road or walkway (e.g. go-karts, rock loaders, lawnmowers, aircraft).
Operating or riding as a passenger on a motorcycle, bicycle, or similar open-air vehicle without a securely fastened safety helmet.
A pedestrian who traverses any roadway consisting of 2+lanes either side(4 lanes across), at a point other than a marked crosswalk or intersection.
Participates in hunting or fishing without a license.

charge: (M) | Hunting/Fishing with a Suspended License | RC701
description: Participates in hunting or fishing with a suspended license.
Inflicts deliberate harm, neglect, or abuse upon animals without legal justification.
Inflicts deliberate death upon animals without legal justification.
Deliberately chases, disturbs, or provokes wildlife, disrupting natural habitat.
Participates in hunting or fishing in a protected area.

charge: (M) | Hunting Outside a Permitted Area | RC707
description: Participates in hunting outside a permitted area.
Participates in hunting while using a weapon other than the designated standard equipment, such as a hunting rifle.
Possesses up to 10 illegal (protected) species of fish or wildlife.
Possesses more than 10 illegal (protected) species of fish or wildlife.
Causes damage or destruction of park flora including grass, bushes, and trees, resulting in environmental harm or defacement.

charge: (I) | Non-display of an Official Inspector Grade | HS450
description: Operating a state-inspected and graded eatery, bar, or business without displaying an Official Inspector Grade of Health and Safety in a designated location.

charge: (I) | Noncompliance with a State Operations Code | HS451
description: Repeated noncompliance with health and safety standards set by the San Andreas Department of Public Health, not rectified on inspections.

charge: (I) | Unauthorized Excessive Modification of a Gov. Building | HS452
description: Unauthorized construction or modification of a government-leased building, assessed for structural integrity and public safety standards.

charge: (F) | Unauthorized Construction Hazardous or Offensive | HS453
description: Unauthorized construction that is hazardous or offensive to the public, assessed by the Department of Public Health.
Any condition deemed hazardous to an individual's health due to negligence, ignorance, malice, or other reasons.
Any physical obstruction to public safety or condition hazardous to operations, endangering physical safety due to negligence, ignorance, malice, etc.
Fails to follow the terms of a written or verbal contract.
Acts without due care or attention, causing damage to people or property. The defendant must have breached a duty they had, and that the breach caused the damages.
As negligence, but within a license profession.

A false written or spoken statement about a person, that is communicated to a third party, where the defendant is at fault for at least negligence, and damages are suffered by the plaintiff's property, business, reputation, or profession. Statements about public officials require actual malice.

charge: (CS) | Tort: Infliction of Emotional Distress | CS804
description: Acts intentionally or recklessly in an extreme or outrageous manner to cause severe emotional distress through negligence or intent.
Intentionally damaging or destroying property.

charge: (M) | Possession of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC100
description: Possess any amount up to 28g of Marijuana, any amount up to 5 Marijuana seeds, any amount up to 10g of Methamphetamine or any amount up to 10g of Cocaine. Possesses prescription medication or other controlled substances without a prescription.

charge: (F) | Felony Possession of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC102
description: Possess more than 28g of Marijuana (1-3 Plants), more than 5 Marijuana seeds, more than 10g of Methamphetamine or more than 10g of Cocaine. Possesses 7+ doses of prescription medication or other controlled substances without a prescription.

charge: (F) | Sale of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC104
description: Sells or Distributes a Controlled Dangerous Substance without legal authorization or licensing.

charge: (F) | Imprisonment of a Gov. Employee | CC171
description: Holds a Government Employee in an area or restrains them for an extended period of time against their will.
The fraudulent acquisition and use of a person's private identifying information.

Any individual who is intoxicated over the legal limit of 0.08% while in public and behaves in a manner that is reasonably disturbing to the public/public space, or is a hazard to themselves or others.
Flees from a motor-vehicle accident without identifying themselves to the other party involved in the accident.
Flees from a motor-vehicle accident that results in serious injury.
Tending to 1 or more marijuana plants.

charge: (F) | Theft of a Gov. Vehicle | CC218
description: Steals a Government Owned vehicle without the legal right to possess it. Government owned vehicles include police vehicles, fire trucks, ambulances, and military vehicles.
Attempts to cause the death of a person with the intention of killing, but that is not premeditated or planned.

charge: (F) | Production of a Controlled Dangerous Substance | CC105
description: Actively produces or attempts to produce a controlled dangerous substance with the proper medical licenses. [Methamphetamine, Cocaine, Marijuana, Prescriptions, Other Controlled Substances]
Fails to appear in court without a justified reason. Time/fine is at Judge’s discretion.
Monthly License Fee for standard trapping license. Permit limits are determined by season, updated by the SAPR with time to rectify any non-compliance.
Uses traps with the intent to catch game and fish without a license
Fee of their cost per trap, engraved by SAPR
Using traps that have not been registered with the SAPR with the intent to catch game and fish. Stackable per trap.
Fee to recover hunting license
Fee to recover a concealed carry license
Abandons property in San Andreas parks, beaches, territories, or trails over 25kg. Abandoned hazardous or toxic waste in any amount.

charge: (M) | Over Maximum Hunting/Fishing Limit >50 Over | RC715
description: Possesses more than the 50-piece-limit but less than 100 hunted animal meat or fish.

charge: (F) | Over Maximum Hunting/Fishing Limit >100 Over | RC716
description: Possesses 100+ hunted animal meat or fish over the (50-piece-limit).

charge: (F) | Attempted Mass Murder of Government Employees | CC167
description: The attempted intentional and premeditated killing of 5+ persons who are employed by the government. This includes LSPD, SIB, BCSO, DOC, SAMS, DOJ, DAO, and Rangers.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes another person to fear imminent death or commits assault while using a deadly weapon.
Intentionally engages in a physical act that causes severe bodily harm to another person without the intent to kill or committing battery while using a deadly weapon. i.e. Firearms

charge: (F) | Felony Battery against an LEO | CC155
description: Commits felony battery against an LEO during the lawful execution of the LEO's duties. Must be used in place of felony battery when appropriate.
Unlawfully entering a residential, commercial, or other secured structure with the intent to commit a theft or any other felony.
Unlawfully entering a Financial Institution or Government Facility with the intent to commit a theft or any other felony.

Unlawful and intentionally interfering with, disabling, or destroying any security device or measure designed to protect property or premises. Includes, but is not limited to, property alarm systems, surveillance equipment, and tracking systems.

The unlawful taking of money or property with a value exceeding $5,000. This includes theft from a person's immediate possession without force. Does not apply to Theft of a Motor Vehicle, Vessel, Aircraft, or Grand Theft Auto.
Depositing waste in an inappropriate location
Operates a seaworthy vessel without permission from the owner or lawful right to operate the vessel.
Intentionally damaging or destroying government property.

charge: (M) | Operating a Motor Vehicle with a Revoked license | HC521
description: Operates a motor vehicle while a license is revoked.

charge: (F) | Operating an Aircraft with a Revoked license | AC554
description: Operates an aircraft while a license is revoked.

charge: (M) | Operating a Boat with a Revoked license | BC600
description: Operates a seaworthy vessel while a license is revoked.

charge: (I) | Operating a Boat without a License | BC601
description: Operates a seaworthy vessel without a valid boating license in possession.

charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 2 Firearm | CC311
description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 2 firearms. Stackable up to 5 times.

charge: (F) | Criminal Possession of a Class 3 Firearm | CC312
description: Possesses 1-5 unregistered, improperly registered, or illegal class 3 firearms. Stackable up to 5 times.
Performs regulated professional activities, without the proper license

charge: (M) | Operating a Business without a License | CC655
description: Operates a business without the appropriate licenses
Urinating or defecating in public that is unwelcome, disturbing, or vandalizes property.

charge: (M) | Misuse of an Emergency Line | CC358
description: Uses an emergency line without proper cause.

charge: (F) | Interrupting a Scheduled Court Case | JC953
description: Interrupting a scheduled court case, causing it to be continuanced or otherwise disrupted in an extreme manner.
Shows disobedience or discourtesy to the Court or its officers. Can be stacked.
Fee to recover fishing license
Inflicts deliberate death upon a domesticated animal without legal justification.
Commission of Assault against the plaintiff. Damages occur based on severity and cause of assault.
Commission of Battery against the plaintiff. Damages occur based on severity and cause of battery.

charge: (CS) | Tort: False Imprisonment and Kidnapping | CS807
description: Commission of the illegal restriction of liberty or movement against the plaintiff.
An unreasonable, unwarranted, or unlawful interference with another person's private use and enjoyment of his or her property. Must be weighed against social benefits and rights.
Intentionally going on land that belongs to someone else or putting something on someone else's property and refusing to remove it.
Intentional unlawful taking or damaging of another person's personal property without the owner's permission.
Maliciously abusing the court system, such as excessive and unfounded civil filings or abusive appeals, causing economic or emotional damages to individuals.

Publicizing private affairs without legitimate public concern OR wrongful intrusion into a person's private activities OR releases private records inappropriately. Public areas grant no expectation of privacy.
Commits fraud against the plaintiff.
An individual or group violating constitutional rights, enumerated or otherwise. Not used in conjunction with other civil statutes.
Transports, possesses, or brings across state lines very large quantities (40+) of unregistered, or improperly registered weapons/explosives. Firearm attachments will not count towards this.

charge: (F) | Possession of a Weaponized Vehicle | CC980
description: The act of owning, operating, or possessing a vehicle fitted with externally mounted, operational weaponry. Any vehicles with these modifications can be seized.

charge: (F) | Criminal use of a Reinforced Vehicle | CC981
description: The intentional use of a vehicle's armored or reinforced components to inflict harm and or ease evasion and capture.

charge: (M) | Negligent Possession of a Class 1 Firearm | CC315
description: Possession of a class 1 firearm for which one is not the lawful, registered owner, under circumstances that do not indicate clear criminal intent.
Blocking devices for accessibility in and around structures, including ramps, doors and pathways.
Knowingly uses intimidation, physical force, threats, or misleading conduct toward another person with the intent to influence, delay, or prevent the testimony of any person in an official proceeding
